TasksVehicle Validation Test Engineer – Power Network ManagementMercedes-Benz Research and Development, India is seeking for a Senior Engineer with a strong technical background in Vehicle Validation of Electronic Control Units.Key Job Responsibilities:Technical:Requirement Analysis of different functions in Body Electronics
Develop test specifications, test scripts and test framework.
Test case execution on dSPACE / Vector platforms.
Development/adaption of FUSA testcases.
Assurance of sufficient test coverage within a given time schedule.
Analysis and debugging of reported failures with relevant stakeholders.
Maximize Test Automation and reduce the time required for testing.
Commissioning and setup of Test Environment for validation.
Definition of work packages for peers and externals with frequent interaction with system and component responsible from Germany/India.
Stakeholder management with business partners in Germany.
Functional integration and application of ECU components and software in the vehicle.
Setting and releasing of vehicle coding.
Organize and participate in test drive (winter/summer).
Participation in SW release and testing on vehicle and providing confirmation.
Ensure certification for the vehicle coding data.Basic Qualification:Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Electronics and Communication/Electrical and Electronics
3-6 years of overall experience in Automotive domainKey Skills and Experience:Automotive domain knowledge – Body electronics/Powertrain/Safety systems: e.g., Door Control module, power windows, sunroof, Interior/ Exterior lighting, airbag, ESP, Powertrain etc. (at least one of the systems)
Expertise in Dspace/Vector Simulators
Expertise in any of the Scripting languages (CAPL, VB, Python)
Expertise in Communication protocols like CAN, LIN, Flexray, Automotive Ethernet
Expertise in Diagnostics testing: UDS.
Experience in Automation of Test cases
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Monitoring of the assigned tasks to team
Good knowledge of Test management tools like DOORS, PREEVision, DOORS NG.
Experience in Functional Testing of Power Network Management / Battery Management System / DCDC Converters would be an added advantage.Preferred Skills:Usage of Vector CAN tools - CANOE, CANape, VTestStudio
Usage of PROVEtech, Control Desk and Configuration Desk
Usage of Softing Tools – MONACO
CAN, FLEXRAY, LIN and Ethernet protocol knowledge,
Usage of DOORS, PREEVision
Good communication skills and ability to work in & contribute as a good team player.
